website_summaries.verdict: A tough trowel that is particularly suited for dry, hard soil.
pros: One-piece construction makes it hardy and rugged
Users enjoy an extra sense of control thanks to the rubber thumb grip
cons: This is for light-duty backpacking use only

customer_reviews.title: Arizona Soil 1. Plastic Trowel 0.
customer_reviews.text: I like that its lightweight but, it really got banged up on the first use. The Arizona ground is very rocky and hard. I feel that it wont last long at all, since the majority of my trips is spent in AZ. I bought this for a backpacking trip for the Grand Canyon and I feel like it will get worse using it there. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap at first, but then you realize you ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap at first, but then you realize you don't need a freaking steel shovel to dig up a small poop hole. This thing does everything it needs to do. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Soria

customer_reviews.title: Could barely dig a hole in rooty area
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a hike in the foothills of SC. It rained most of our trip so the ground was pretty soft. Despite that, this shovel could barely turn over any dirt. It probably works great in other areas with less roots but for where I was you need something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handier than you might think....
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I feel silly packing things like this, when you can always just kick a hole or grab a rock to scrape things out. But it's light as a feather and convenient as heck--especially when I'm hunting and want to bury things a bit deeper to reduce scent in the area. And it's mighty handy to scrape flat a little area for tent set-up, so you don't have that gnarly think poking you through your sleeping pad.
customer_reviews.author: Gary McCaleb

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, poor design
customer_reviews.text: -2 stars : Shovel is flimsy, the tip folded over, and wouldn't dig a hole ion the soil. i would not count on it for backpacking -1 star : Wrong color, i thought i was getting orange, instead i got black -1 star : Rubber thumb grip came unglued on first use For such a simple product, this is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Not complicated
customer_reviews.text: It is a small plastic shovel, nothing fancy. But it is perfect for underwater gardening in large fish tanks with live plants. The materials can't rust and can't harm my fish. Unless you stab a fish with the pointy end I suppose. And I do have that one fish that tends to bite. I would still recommend this trowel to others who need to move large amounts of substrate in planted tanks. It also works well with live sand in salt water tanks.
customer_reviews.author: RS Badger

customer_reviews.title: Ok for loose-ish soil, not so much for packed or rocky ground
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that it is lightweight, but it has definitely come up against soil that it could not penetrate. Admittedly, this was Icelandic soil, so it is inherently tougher than the rest of the world, but I was worried about snapping it with less than an inch in the ground. It is convenient to have the measurements marked on it. I will bring a metal one next time, despite the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Perez

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but light and cheap, great scoop for soil bags.
customer_reviews.text: This feels flimsy and I will never use it for heavy digging (no doubt it would snap), but it is lightweight and cheap. I actually use mine to scoop potting soil out of bags, I've never taken it backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Better than metal alternatives
customer_reviews.text: It is much lighter and much nicer than metal alternatives. Plastic means that you are not afraid to cut yourself. It is strong enough to withstand serious abuse. The grip is easy to hold, and the volume is such that in good soil you need to dig 2-3 times to get 6 inch deep hole.
customer_reviews.author: Magus

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do with a little extra work.
customer_reviews.text: It's a shovel...it digs holes. After 1 use, however, the tip is dented and chipped due to the plastic material. It doesn't dig through rocks very well. This is best used for softer soils. Super light weight and easy to grip handle. The bright orange color made it easy to find in my pack. Just wish it was sturdier or had a shorter handle for better maneuvering.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Think twice about plastic.
customer_reviews.text: First off I want to say that I should have known better than thinking that this would be a strong shovel seeing as though it's plastic. The pros, it dug the holes so I could do what needed done on a weekend backpacking trip, but just barely. A roll of toilet paper also fits very well on the handle.The cons, if I had been out for one more day I do believe that it would have broken. Overall, it would be good for a soft garden but not for digging a hole and time is of the essence and the upmost importance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty !
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is amazing. Yes it's light and made of plastic, but boy does this go the extra mile. We use it mainly for when we are at the beach for digging holes and making sand castles with the kid. It's been thrown around, stuffed tightly into bags and exposed to mud, sand and sea water. It's not shown any wear or tear. It's a sturdy wee thing!
customer_reviews.author: Logangirlie

customer_reviews.title: Not for rocky soil
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this yet, but out of the package the tip is rather soft and I'm sure will not hold up well in rocky or tree rooted soils. I would guess as a latrine tool in soft soil it will do okay. I would just use my boot heal.
customer_reviews.author: BoiseDude

customer_reviews.title: Good size, vibrant colors
customer_reviews.text: Upsides: Comes exactly as shown. Good size, vibrant colors, hards plastic, and super lightweight. Definitely doesn't feel like it will break any time soon. Downsides: Against denser soil it is fairly inefficient. You'll eventually break through, but you'll be digging for a while to get a good trench going. Verdict: would make a great garden shovel, but for backpacking, I recommend buying an actual metal trench shovel.
customer_reviews.author: bclaymier

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Sturdy Shovel
customer_reviews.text: I needed a plastic shovel to bring to a fossil dig in a marl pit. It was comfortable to use, sturdy and light weight. Suited my purpose just fine. The marl pit was a damp, dense, grainy soil. There were no roots. I do plan to use it in my garden bed, and I think it will do fine there as well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Super duper puper scuper
customer_reviews.text: Does what it was purchased for. Do you need more information? It's plastic. Don't dig in compacted gravel and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: More ergonomic, IMHO, than the popular metal poop hole digger. Sturdy enough, the only con is it is relatively huge.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Like a toy out of a sand castle play set
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi Watermelon

customer_reviews.title: Best digging trowel, tie a bright ribbon on the handle
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my arthritic hands because I need a stout handle. It's very light, perfect for backpacking. Tie some bright flashing on the handle so you won't overlook it when you're leaving camp (and so your fellow backpackers will remember to return it to you).
customer_reviews.author: Emigrant1

customer_reviews.title: Light!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to "clean up" behind my 8 pound 4 legger. Light enough to carry on long walks, wide scoop & easy to clean with a hose.
customer_reviews.author: Electric man

customer_reviews.title: It's a poop shovel?
customer_reviews.text: Won't work in super hard or rocky soil but it's a poop shovel...are you really going to be using it to dig out a cave? No.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine Walker

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: Back packers know what this is primarily for and to follow sanitation rules in the wilderness you need to have one, might as well be light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: works great. Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, so don't get it to dig through hard clay. For soft soil and potting project, works great. Great value for price. Prompt shipping
customer_reviews.author: tim c

customer_reviews.title: great mini shovel/trowel worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for what I needed it for. Needed a nice sized trowel for my indoor gardening that wasn't too expensive or too big! Sturdy, lightweight & gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Cammy

customer_reviews.title: Light weight hand shovel
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to add to our hiking gear. They are sturdy and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: What it looks like and what is described is accurate. You can count on your information.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for my Grandkids and it was easy and fast to get it here. I want them outside and learning in a million ways.
customer_reviews.author: H. Rosling

customer_reviews.title: Strong and useful.... Good price too
customer_reviews.text: It's well made and strong.. I don't think you could go wrong, if it's the type you want.. Buy with confidence...
customer_reviews.author: R & I Peters

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: You’re gonna need one if you plan to poop in the woods. Doesn’t cut through roots too great, but it’s lightweight which I found more important.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trowel
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it does the job and is light. I took it on the Appalachian trail for a ways and totally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Neal L.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, light and useful.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says and does it well. Lightweight. I used is on moderately hard dirt and and it did not bend or break.
customer_reviews.author: Feaster

customer_reviews.title: Light and bright
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet but it’s bright and light for a long backpack trip. Feels very sturdy for the overall weight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not a fan
customer_reviews.text: not a fan! very lightweight plastic. not worth returning. fine for easy tasks but don’t expect they will last very long
customer_reviews.author: RJMAC

customer_reviews.title: Does an Amazon reviewer crap in the woods?
customer_reviews.text: Does a bear crap in the woods? Yep, and so do I when I go backpacking. This shovel is strong for plastic and light. I have been able to dig sufficiently large holes in different types of soil to responsibly do my business in the woods. It only failed to be able to dig in the driest, hardest ground I found.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and digs well. It's a shovel so not much else to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this shovel and the price point, but the plastic split on our first backpacking trip. The adage you get what you pay for holds true and my next shovel will be of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality light shovel
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great for burying turds when camping out in the great outdoors. Cons: Not reliable bear defense tool.
customer_reviews.author: Genia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a trowel should. A nice sturdy, lightweight product for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Marquez

customer_reviews.title: So light didn’t notice it was there!
customer_reviews.text: This came in very handy for the 4-day backpacking trip we took this summer, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Worked well and was light weight for backpacking. Only ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and was light weight for backpacking. Only thing is that it was hard to dig in really wooded areas because it's plastic and there were a ton of roots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: keep your fingernails clean and get this shovel
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done and is very light. All my friends teased for me carrying this but then they all used it!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: As light as described
customer_reviews.text: I love how light this is. It's worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: As advertised.. Nothing more nothing less.. After all it's a plastic trowel.. Arrived on time..
customer_reviews.author: Mark Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: It was light yet sturdy enough to dig a cat hole in cold but unfrozen Candian soil.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Dig it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast, seems solid, very light. For the price of titanium I can carry the extra ounce
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight tool with depth markings. Should be helpful on the John Muir Trail this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Sailing-soon

customer_reviews.title: but I can already tell it is waaay more sturdy than other lightweight towels I've used
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but I can already tell it is waaay more sturdy than other lightweight towels I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Ward

customer_reviews.title: Lasted The PCT
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a trowel for The PCT and used in during the entire trek. Cheap, and never broke!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Worked great during a 5 day backpacking trip. Sturdy enough to dig a hole on rocky ground.
customer_reviews.author: Stef A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to garden at the prison where I work. It is strong enough to dig the weeds out.
customer_reviews.author: DIANA J.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Light but strong. seventeen more words are required to leave feedback. Now I only need nine. Now four. and none.
customer_reviews.author: stephen edson

customer_reviews.title: perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight for backpacking. Could not ask for better
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Light work use only. More flimsy than you  would think.
customer_reviews.text: This is for LIGHT use only. While sturdy, the spade bends and the first 2" at the tip bend very easily. If the soil is soft and/or broken then it's fine and has worked. For a recent job, I was taking up gray square bricks, scraping and digging the ground to make them more level than what they were. This trowel is not a good choice and made the task take much longer than expected.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mason

customer_reviews.title: I dig it
customer_reviews.text: It did its job. Just used it on a backpacking trip with my two daughters, and it’s a little scratched up from digging cat holes in the DG for the three of us, but it dug fast enough to prevent any accidents from my 6 and 9 year olds and their last minute “emergencies.”
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Creature comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great little trowl and it sure beats using your heel to dig a trench. And even better than stepping in it while trying to cover it up, ask me how I know.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my trowel. It's light and strong and works well on soft/intermediate dirt.
customer_reviews.author: cigarguy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking hike.
customer_reviews.text: Going on a men's group hike and needed a light weight trowel for backpacking. Perfect for what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lightweight hiking shovel to dig your poop holes. Leave no trace, kids!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McMahon

product_meta.title: Grizzly Peak Ultra Lightweight 11" Backpacker's Trowel
product_meta.description: When you're preparing for a backpacking trip, this backpacker's trowel from Grizzly Peak should be number two on your list of things to bring. Constructed as a single piece of durable plastic, it carves through tough ground without breaking or cracking. Measuring 11" by 3.5" and weighing just under 2 ounces, it's perfect for the lightest of lightweight travels. Coming in both orange and black, this trowel features a rubber thumb grip and depth gauge to be sure you commune with nature without ever leaving a trace.
feature_bullets: An indispensable tool for dispensing in the Great Outdoors
Tough, single piece plastic construction stays strong in hard, dry soils
Features a rubber thumb grip for superior control, and a metric/imperial depth gauge
Weighs just under 2 ounces, great for ultralight backpackers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
